{"value":[{"id":200,"job_id":"164041","company_id":"4506","job_title":"IAM Solutions Engineer","job_type":"Full-Time","job_desc":"

Title: IAM Solutions Engineer

Location: Denver, CO

Type: Direct hire/Perm


The target compensation for this role is between 125k - 135k.Actual compensation may vary, depending on an individual’s experience, qualifications, and location.


We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively managed products. We are truly global, supporting our individual and institutional investors across a range of products, encompassing equities, fixed income, multi-asset, and alternatives. Our high-energy and collaborative helps our client achieve their goals and ensures that our people love the place they work.

Our culture is the foundation for how we interact with clients and one another as part of our unique, people-focused work environment. We support a flexible hybrid working model that allows teams to build a strong and positive culture by inspiring innovation and increasing collaboration. Currently our hybrid working model allows employees to work 2 or more days in office and the remaining time remotely.

Overview of the role

The Global Technology Department’s Information Security (IS) team is responsible for the management and protection of Investors' computer applications/systems and associated data from unauthorized and inappropriate access. Additionally, the team is responsible for managing end-user identity, end-user application access, end-user directory access and the user and application security lifecycle from provisioning to de-provisioning of access rights.

As an Identity and Access Management (IAM) Solutions Engineer you will work as a member of the IS team and will assist with the overall strategic architectural direction. Your main responsibility will be to help support, deliver, and maintain the IAM roadmap. Previous experience with SailPoint is required. You will provide direction and IAM expertise to the business to help drive the inclusion of IAM principles and requirements, as necessary. This includes, but is not limited to, working collaboratively with our partners (HR, service desk, application owners & infrastructure teams) to promote widely adopted practices.

As part of the functions in this role, you will be required to keep information confidential, have attention to detail, and adhere to pre-defined processes and procedures.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Maintain oversight of the implementation of IAM systems according to project requirements to ensure appropriate and effective security controls.
  • Work with modern and existing IAM standards such as OAuth and SAML.
  • Domain expertise with enterprise implementation of related IAM and privileged access management (PAM) security solutions (e.g., SailPoint, Active Directory, Citrix, Thycotic/Dilinea, etc.).
  • Assist in new technology rollouts to ensure standards are being maintained.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with internal and external business partners, including regulatory and compliance teams to identify business and technical requirements.
  • Apply organizational policies and procedures and recommend changes or improvements to procedures or processes.
  • Participate in business recovery planning and exercises.
  • Maintain, implement, and assist in the definition of security and company policies as determined by the CISO, Risk, Compliance and Audit.
  • Overtime and weekend hours may be required.
  • Carry out additional duties as assigned.

Technical skills and qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.
  • At least 2 years engineering SailPoint solutions.
  • Experience with enterprise architecture and deployment of SailPoint solutions.
  • Detailed knowledge of SailPoint and desirable knowledge of PAM integration.
  • At least 4 years of technology & security/IAM engineer experience.
  • Understanding of and experience with the product development life cycle and project management.
  • ServiceNow experience preferred.
  • Knowledge of security access technologies particularly Active Directory, Azure and Exchange Online.
  • Knowledge of application-based security, file, and folder security.
  • Desirable knowledge of Business Systems particularly Charles River, SAP HR, SAP Finance, SAP GRC, Salesforce, and SharePoint.


Max Trujillo
Technical Recruiter
Ascent
720-573-5273

Packaging Operations DesignerLocation - Sunnyvale (Hybrid on-site Mon, Tues and Thurs)Planet Technology is seeking a Packaging Operations Designer to work for our client located in Sunnyvale, CA.The Product Graphics Studio Production Designer supports the Product Graphics team with production and design tasks in the implementation of artwork for sustaining products. In addition, they perform miscellaneous production tasks such as reviewing vendor part marking specifications and test devices. The ideal candidate is meticulous and detail oriented, shows ingenuity in solving problems, is resourceful, and is dedicated to achieving high quality standards. They are dependable, calm under pressure, and able to learn quickly and cope with rapid change.Responsibilities:
  • Supports Product Graphics Designers by revising all sustaining hardware product artwork with general text and content updates, regulatory changes, and font updates. Graphics are for implementation on products, components, and individual parts.
  • For Regulatory updates, works with Designers on design needs, intent, requirements, and interpretation, and with Project Manager to understand key implementation dates and the product localization matrix.
  • Understands the client’ s design style and product ecosystem to ensure brand consistency. Works with Graphics Manager to find the best compromise between design intent and regulatory constraints.
  • Ensures all artwork has been reviewed and approved by the Product Graphics Designers and delivered on time for cross-functional team review.
  • Supports Product Graphics team with graphics specifications and best practices documentation. Participates in process improvement to make the workflow more efficient.
Qualifications/Requirements:
  • BA degree in Graphics Design or equivalent.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience in a design organization for consumer electronics/consumer goods. Project management experience a plus.
  • Strong knowledge of fundamental design principles. Well-honed eye for sophisticated design, quality, and consistency.
  • Mastery in graphic and production design and in the application of typography best practices.
  • Understands line-weights and how they appear on various surface materials: plastics/metals/fibers/other.
  • Ability to read 3D CAD drawings.
  • Meticulous attention to detail.
  • Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously while tracking milestones and deliverables.
  • Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator [Expert], In-Design, Photoshop. Proficiency in Mac Applications: Pages, Numbers, Keynote, and in Microsoft Office. Database management systems a plus.
  • Trustworthy in a highly confidential environment. Supportive of company values.
  • Strong work ethic. Accountable for actions. Takes initiative.
  • Highly motivated and goal oriented. Follows through from beginning to completion.
  • Positive, attentive, focused, and engaged.
  • Straightforward, honest, and diplomatic demeanor when dealing with others.
  • Exceptional communication (interpersonal and written) and follow-up skills.
  • Adaptable to frequent change. Works well under pressure.
  • Manages time effectively.
  • Collaborative “ team-player.”
  • Knowledge of manufacturing and production phases a plus.
","skills":"Make, Hardware, Documentation, Project Management, Design, Photoshop, Implementation, Rapid, Illustrator, Database Management","qualification_req":"Bachelor's Of Degree","mailing_address":"jackhenry@planettech.com","job_location":"Menlo Park,CALIFORNIA","company_name":"Planet Technology","status":1,"created":"2022-09-07T11:21:40.000Z","logo_url":"https://i1.wp.com/planet-technology.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/cropped-planet_technology_logo_01.png","logofilename":"planet-technology.webp"},{"id":179,"job_id":"137186","company_id":"4504","job_title":"MANET Systems Engineer Clearance","job_type":"Full-Time","job_desc":"

MANET Systems Engineer – Clearance

**$89.65/hour**

*Interim or active SECRET clearance required to begin work*

Kelly Government Solutions is hiring for a MANET systems engineer with a security clearance on a government contract with our customer in St. Petersburg, FL. This assignment should last approximately one year and could be extended or turn into a permanent hire.

Job Description:

Architect and develop systems engineering solutions for MANET specific DOD developments.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Architect and integrate directional RF communications networking algorithms and operations.
  • Incorporate Protocols for Multibeam Antenna and MESH networking, including network acquisition and management, develop Transmit/Receive and Link Scheduling algorithms.
  • Evaluate Routing algorithms including trade studies and assessment in selection of proactive, reactive, and hybrid protocols.
  • The candidate should be experienced in performing Modeling/Simulation of network performance with MATLAB/C++ or other simulation tools and have experience evaluating prototype hardware for MANET integration.

Required Skill Sets:

  • Experience with Mobile Ad hoc Networks for commercial or military applications.
  • Familiar with proactive, reactive, and hybrid protocols.
  • Experience working with MAC layer protocols.

Required Education:

Bachelors in STEM; masters preferred.

Years of Experience Required (if any):

Eight (8) years or more.

Desired Skill Sets:

  • Team leadership and presentation skills.
  • Experience working on DOD contracts, particularly the US Navy.
  • Knowledge or past experience with Scrum / Agile teams

Please email Drew Rogers at wilr037@kellyservices.com if you are interested, and we’ll set up a quick phone interview to discuss further.

• Experience with Siemens Teamcenter• Experience building new Teamcenter environments• Strong troubleshooting skills, i.e. network issues• Windows Administration• Linux experience• Develop and modify PowerShell scripts• Install and configure servers• Configure server roles and features• Deploy and configure core network services• Install and administer Active Directory• Create and manage Group Policy• Certificate and Account Management• Windows task scheduling• Setup and configuration of F5 and Web-tier components• WebSphere/JBOSS• SQL, Oracle• Implementation of Automation• Agile experience desired

Ability to Work as a self-starter and follow organizational processes and procedures and adjust to rapidly changing priorities.

If interested and meet the necessary requirements, please e-mail me your most up to date resume to LNpatterson@apexsystems.com

EEO Employer

Title: Robotics Software Engineer
Full-time/Direct Hire Opportunity
Location: San Jose, CA (onsite)
Start Date: ASAP
No C2C/Corp-to-Corp
Must be authorized to work in US without restriction or sponsorship

Responsibilities:

  • Research, integrate, and develop robotic frameworks to build processes for non-planar, additive materials deposition
  • Drive solutions for robotic-based conformal printing
  • Integrate various hardware and software subsystems into a coherent solution
    Skills:
  • BS/MS in applicable field (e.g., robotics, EE, ME, CS)
  • Practical experience developing machine learning systems, frameworks, and libraries
  • Experience with ROS or other robotics frameworks
  • A desire to learn new innovative technologies and to improve personal development and skills
  • Open to new challenges and work independently across disciplines to both investigate issues and identify solutions
  • Strong software development skills that encourage code reuse among researchers and ability to write efficient, clean, and reusable code (C++ and Python)
  • Solve fast paced hands-on complex problems
    Preferred Qualifications:
  • MS/PHD in applicable field (e.g., robotics, EE, ME, CS)
  • Hardware integration experience for mechatronic systems (e.g., PLC, safety, controllers)
  • Computational geometry knowledge for world modelling (obstacles etc); understanding of sensor processing stacks (vision, LiDAR, etc) and gracefully handling noise

Experience: Senior Level

**Hybrid - 1-2 days/week onsite - Qualified applicants will be local to the Pittsburgh area.** Our client, a retail industry leader, needs a Junior Help Desk Support Specialist to join their team. Excellent opportunity to build your career with a top-ranked employer!

This is a contract to hire opportunity. Applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis and convert to FTE following contract duration. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.

Responsibilities of the Junior Help Desk Support Specialist:
  • Provide first level IT support for all end users
  • Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and voice/data communication systems issues
  • Write concise, informative incident tickets
  • Escalate calls as needed
Requirements of the Junior Help Desk Support Specialist:
  • Degree preferred but great experience can substitute!
  • Broad knowledge and proficiency with popular operating systems, application software, desktop and laptop computers, printers, and networks
  • Customer service orientation 
  • Effective and professional communication skills
Job ID: 368737

About Eliassen Group:

Eliassen Group provides strategic consulting and talent solutions to drive our clients’ innovation and business results. Our purpose is to positively impact the lives of our employees, clients, consultants, and the communities in which we operate. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in talent solutions, life sciences consulting, Agile consulting, cloud services, risk management, business optimization, and managed services enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA, and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence and deep networks, as well as national reach.

Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Don’t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a $1,000 referral check!
